raw_text:
Soderling wins tense Milan final
 
 Fifth seed Robin Soderling took the Milan Indoors title with a dramatic win over Radek Stepanek in Sunday's final.
 
 The 20-year-old Swede edged the final set tie-break for a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory and his second tour title after winning in Lyon last year. "I'm delighted to have won against such a good opponent in a tournament of this importance," said Soderling. "I was really on form, my service was good and I really liked playing on the synthetic surface." Soderling, the world number 37, shrugged off a nervous start to take the opening set on his first set point. A change in approach from fourth seed Stepanek in the second set paid dividends as he took it on a tie-break, but Soderling's superior power proved too much in the third.
llama3.2:1b: Robin Soderling wins Milan final against Radek Stepanek.
llama3.2:3b: Robin Soderling won the Milan Indoors title with a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory over Radek Stepanek in the final, his second tour title after winning in Lyon last year.
gemma2:2b: Robin Soderling won the Milan Indoors title by defeating Radek Stepanek in a tense final.  Soderling overcame a nervous start to win the final set 7-6 (7-5), securing his second tour title after winning in Lyon last year.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Swede wins Milan title after edge over Radek Stepanek - 20-year-old Swede edged the final set tie-break for victory.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Swedish fifth seed Robin Soderling won the Milan Indoors title against Radek Stepanek with a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory, earning his second tour title after last year's Lyon win.
qwen2.5:3b: Fifth-seeded Robin Soderling claimed the Milan Indoors title with a nerve-wracking 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory over Radek Stepanek. The 20-year-old Swede, ranked world No. 37, triumphed in his second tournament of the year following his win in Lyon last year. Soderling praised his form and served well on the synthetic surface, securing the opening set on his first match point despite a sluggish start. In the second set, Stepanek switched tactics but was unable to counter Soderling's powerful play in the third set, leading to a decisive victory.
opencoder:1.5b: Soderling wins the Milan final with Radek Stepanek winning over his first match. He has won more matches than any other player and is known for his exceptional defensive capabilities.
smollm:1.7b: Soderling won the 2019 Indoors title at Milan with a 6-3 win over Radek Stepanek in the second set.

I remember that Soderling was fifth seed and he edge came back from a close set, 6-3 6-7 (2-7), then 7-6 (7-5). He's been pretty consistent lately, being ranked number 37 on the ATP list, so that adds to his confidence.

He said he was thrilled about facing such a strong opponent and that he was on form. His service was good, and he liked playing on synthetic courts, which is common in tournaments now. The text also mentions that Stepanek didn't start well but managed to take the second set's tie-break. Soderling's superior power in the third set probably made him win against Stepanek.

</think>

Robin Soderling secured the Milan Indoors final victory by defeating Radek Stepanek in a thrilling 6-3 6-7 (2-7) and 7-5 7-6 (7-5) game. Known for his consistency, Soderling was on form with a strong service and appreciated facing such a formidable opponent. The victory brought him to World Tour qualification from the fifth seed position.
tinyllama:1.1b: The fifth seed Robin Soderling won the Milan Indoor title after defeating Radek Stepanek in a dramatic final set tiebreaker on Sunday. The 20-year-old Swede edged out his French opponent in a tight final set and claimed his second ATP Tour title, beating Stepanek 6-3, 7-6(5) for the trophy. Sooderling was a formidable opponent throughout, with his game featuring high-quality serving and power shots. His win marked his fourth career tournament victory on the ATP Tour, following in the footsteps of his previous wins in Lyon last year. The match was a closely contested affair that saw both players make critical errors at the start, but Sooderling's superior power proved too much to overcome.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Soderling wins tense Milan final, advancing to ATP Finals for first time; fifth seed beats sixth seed Stepanek in thrilling decider. The fourth seed overcame a slow start and played his best tennis of the tournament to take the title against Radek Stepanek, winning 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5).
phi:2.7b: Robin Soderling won the Milan Indoors title with a dramatic win over Radek Stepanek, taking the final set tie-break for a 6-3 victory and his second tour title after winning in Lyon last year. He was delighted to have played against such a good opponent and had performed well on the synthetic surface.

Soderling had a good performance on his service and liked playing on the synthetic surface. He won the first set point in the opening set and capitalized on his opponent's mistake to take the second set tie-break. In the third set, Stepanek's loss of focus proved costly for him as Soderling outpowered him with his greater power.
hermes3:3b: Robin Soderling wins Milan Indoors final over Radek Stepanek, 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5).

The 20-year-old Swede praised his performance on the synthetic surface and dominated in the final set tie-break after initially struggling. Soderling's second tour title followed last year's win in Lyon.

Soderling praised his form, strong service, and the synthetic surface. Despite a nervous start, he took the first set, but Stepanek adjusted his strategy to win the second in a tie-break. However, Soderling's superior power helped him prevail in the decisive third-set tie-break.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Robin Soderling, ranked 37th, secured his second tour title by defeating Radek Stepanek 6-3, 6-7 (2-7), 7-6 (7-5) in a thrilling Milan Indoors final on Sunday. Despite a shaky start and nervousness, Soderling dominated the match, particularly in the third set tie-break. He praised the synthetic court for enhancing his performance.
